Articles.Content:
Hi! After a new install (v0.25.0642) of ksp no more mods will work under 32-bit.

They work under 64-bit as they should, but some of them are not supporting 64-bit (like Real Chutes).

don't know what's wrong with 32-bit
Hello, have you updated your mods ? Could you send us your log, if you don't know how to find it: How To Get Support and send us your logs
Yes, all Mods are up to date. Here's the log Dropbox.

It seems that you can't load plugins, all plugins makes an error on the loading, don't know if this can help, but can you try to start the game in administrator?

And I also see an error "out of memory" in KSP32b you are limited to 3.5 Gib of memory.

Exactly that's wierd. Admin or not, via steam or ksp.exe - it doesn't matter.

I also started a clean install with only 2 mods (Toolbar and FinalFrontier) but none of the mods are active ingame.

LeftAlt+f doesn't do anything, but it should open the FinalFrontier for example. So i don't think it's the 3.5Gb limit at all.

On loading sequence they shown up as loaded.

If i start with ksp_x64.exe, all seems to be ok - except the unsupported mods and the normal CTDs, of course.

Edit: Solved the problem - Firewall sandboxed ksp.exe *facepalm*

Thank you for your help and pointing me the right direction!

Edited November 19, 2014 by Kermon
solved
